'''Litleo''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''シシコ''' ''Shishiko'') is a dual-type {{2t|Fire|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Pyroar}} starting at [[level]] 35.

==Biology==
Litleo are quadruped, feline Pokémon. They are mostly dark brown in color with pale brown paws, ears, tail tip, and face. They have a short, rounded muzzle with a reddish orange nose and round ears. Their eyes are circular with black irises and white pupils and sclera. There is a reddish orange tuft of fur between their ears. Each of their paws has three toes and a dark brown paw pad. Their tail ends in a pointed, teardrop shape.

In battle, its short mane radiates heat, and when up against a strong opponent, the temperature increases. When wild Litleo grow stronger, they are kicked out of the pack and begin to live alone. Litleo is a hot-blooded Pokémon that is curious by nature and is quick to start fights.

==In the anime==
===Major appearances===
[[File:Litleo anime.png|thumb|left|250px|Litleo in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
Litleo debuted in ''[[PK26|Pikachu, What's This Key?]]''.

Four Litleo appeared in ''[[XY097|A Fiery Rite of Passage!]]''. One of them was forced to leave the pride by {{p|Pyroar}}, but with {{Ash}}'s help, it was able to become independent and return to its pride.

===Minor appearances===
A Litleo made its main series debut in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Performer}} competing in the {{to|Dendemille}} {{pkmn|Showcase}}. It reappeared in ''[[XY091|A Performance Pop Quiz!]]'', where it participated in the {{ci|Anistar}} Showcase; and in ''[[XY109|Master Class Choices!]]'', where it participated in the {{ci|Fleurrh}} Showcase. It reappeared once more in ''[[XY112|Master Class is in Session!]]'', where it was used in the Master Class Showcase in [[Gloire City]].

Multiple Litleo appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'', including one during a flashback. Another was seen as one of the Pokémon at [[Nebel Plateau]].

Two Litleo appeared during a flashback in ''[[SS036|The Legend of X, Y, and Z!]]''.

Two Trainers' Litleo appeared in ''[[SM034|A Crowning Moment of Truth!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Manabu Litleo.png|thumb|left|140px|Litleo in [[Let's Play the Pokémon Card Game XY!]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Litleo owned by a girl in [[Vaniville Town]] is seen running away with her in ''[[PAXY02|X-actly What They Wanted]]''.

A Litleo appeared with a {{tc|Preschooler}} in [[Lumiose City]] in ''[[PAXY10|Pangoro Poses a Problem]]''.

A wild Litleo appeared in ''[[PAXY05|Kangaskhan...Kangascan't]]'' battling against {{adv|X}} as he trained on {{rt|22|Kalos}}.

In ''[[PAORAS02|Omega Alpha Adventure 2]]'', a Litleo appears on the ticket to the [[Mossdeep Space Center]], that {{adv|Ruby}} gave to {{adv|Sapphire}}, to watch the [[Litleonids]] after their current mission.

===In the Let's Play the Pokémon Card Game XY! manga===
[[Manabu Kadoo|Manabu]] used a Litleo that later can evolve into a male {{p|Pyroar}} in Let's Play the Pokémon Card Game XY!.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Litleo and {{p|Pyroar|its evolution}}.
* No other Pokémon has the same [[List of Pokémon by gender ratio|gender ratio]] — [[:Category:Pokémon with a gender ratio of one male to seven females|one male to seven females]] — as Litleo and {{p|Pyroar|its evolution.}}
* Litleo is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 369.
* The [[Litleonids|Litleonid meteor shower]] in [[Pokémon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire]] is named after this Pokémon, a reference to the {{wp|Leonids|Leonid meteor shower}}.

===Origin===
Litleo is based on a lion cub.

====Name origin====
Litleo may be a combination of ''little'', ''lit'', and ''[[wiktionary:leo|leo]]'' (Latin for lion).

Shishiko is a combination of 獅子 ''shishi'' (lion) and 子 ''ko'' (child).
